full_text:
Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 499-2 Filed 11/23/21 Page 30 of 159
LBAGmax2 Rocchio - Direct
1 listservs to provide communication, and then creating a healthy clinical picture as well.
2
3 Q. Dr. Rocchio, have you testified in court before?
4 A. I have.
5 Q. How many times?
6 A. Twice.
7 Q. Were you qualified as an expert when you testified previously?
8 A. I was.
9
10 Q. On what subject were you qualified as an expert?
11 A. I was qualified as an expert in psychology with a specialized expertise in traumatic stress and complex trauma.
12
13 Q. Dr. Rocchio, I want to ask you about the specific opinions you have offered in this case.
14
15 How are most instances of childhood sexual abuse committed?
16
17 A. Majority are committed without the use of force. They're committed with the use of nonviolence, coercive and controlling tactics, but without the use of physical force and violence.
18
19 Q. Are most instances of childhood sexual abuse committed by strangers or people known to children?
20
21 A. They're generally committed by people known to the children in the context of a relationship between the perpetrator and the child.
22
23 Q. Based on your experience, research and training, are you
24
25
SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300
DOJ-OGR-00007898
